meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #c 「今天咱們來聊聊掃墓節的事。」
#n C: 朱阿良先生, M, 77 K: 高德盛先生, M, 77
#n Note: C: kalih a 'oemaw, M, 77K: paran a 'oemaw, M, 77

free: #e "How do you pay respects to the dead in Tungho?"
#c 「你們東河的人是怎樣祭祖掃墓呢。」

meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8
朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #e "Whoever arrives ahead, to arrive ahead is good."
#c 「我們那邊如果早上 ... ... 今天呀，看看誰先到，如果最先到的就最好了。」

meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8
朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #e "Whoever comes last will get a scolding."
#c 「誰最晚到，就會被罵說：『為什麼會這麼晚到呢？』」

meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8
朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #e "Every member of the clan should be there."
#c 「如果我們也（去掃墓），那們全姓的人就要通通都來。」

meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8
朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #e "The weeding should have been finished (once all the clans have arrived)."
#c 「一個姓的人全部到了，然後砍草的工作都做好了，全部的人就可以吃了。」
#n XXX的部分聽不出實際的語音，此句解釋是發音人推測的
#n Note: XXX portion is inaudible; the translation is an inference made by Informant.

free: #e "After we finish (weeding), we wait for the others. There are three clans altogether."
#c 「祭拜完了，然後我們（每一個人）就等三個姓的人通通到齊。」
#n Note: isaa ma is a fixed expression.

free: #e "We wait for everybody. Once everybody has finished, we come to the river."
#c 「(每一個人就地)等全部的人都到齊，來到河邊這兒。」

free: #e "The food to be offered has to be cut/sliced."
#c 「然後把祭品全部剁成一塊一塊，然後吃掉。」
#n isaa o: 是固定用語，是出現在句首的篇章標記。
#n Note: isaa o: is a fixed expression, usually a discourse marker occurs in clause initial.

free: #e "People used to be good drinkers and used to drink a lot until around three in the afternoon."
#c 「像以前呀，很多人都很會喝酒；酒有很多，喝到三點左右。」

free: #e "Now the situation is much better. So if each household brings one bottle, "
#c 「 ... ... 然後，如果一家（帶）一瓶酒的話，然後 ... ... ,」

meta.speaker: 朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8
朱阿良, kalaeh a oemaw, male, 1928-8-8

free: #e  "The young people were very good drinkers. (There might not be enough wine.)"
#c 「年輕人這樣喝酒好像（每個人）都很行。」
#n wa'isan 'strong' 強、強壯, wa'wa'isan 'be good at' 很會、好手

free: #e "Otherwise, what are you going to do with the food but to share them with everybody?"
#c 「不然的話，那個拜過的東西你們怎麼弄 ... ... （大家一起）享用嗎？」

#c 「雞啊，豬肉呀，還有 ... ... 反正三牲就是啦。」

free: #e "One clan helps buy the things needed for everybody"
#c 「你們那邊一個姓的人替其他人買祭品給大家。」

free: #e "We contribute money for the pasbaki celebration. But we buy for our own on tombsweeping."
#c 「在那裡 ... ... 啊 ... ... 祖靈祭的話錢就蒐集在一起；那個是掃墓節，自己買多少（就多少）。」
